record_data.record_plain_text: 6. Ancillary Services: New England: PSEG New Haven offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England Inc. Third Party Provider. Seller offers Regulation Service, Energy Imbalance Service, Spinning Reserves, and Supplemental Reserves. Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier; and (3) sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 5. Effective Date: This Rate Schedule shall be effective on the date authorized by the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission (???Commission???).
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 8. Compliance with Commission Regulations. PSEG New Haven shall comply with the provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning PSEG New Haven???s market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes PSEG New Haven to engage in affiliate sales under this tariff or otherwise restricts or limits PSEG New Haven???s market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 CFR Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning PSEG New Haven???s market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this tariff.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 4. Other Terms and Conditions: All other terms and conditions shall be established by mutual agreement between the purchaser and PSEG New Haven.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 1. Availability: PSEG New Haven LLC (???PSEG New Haven??? or ???Seller???) makes electric capacity, energy and ancillary services available under this Rate Schedule to any purchaser for resale.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text:
PSEG New Haven LLC
Market-Based Rate Tariff
FERC Electric Tariff, Volume No. 1
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 3. Rates: All sales shall be made at rates established by mutual agreement between the purchaser and PSEG New Haven.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 2. Applicability: This schedule is applicable to all sales of energy, capacity or ancillary services by PSEG New Haven not otherwise subject to a particular rate schedule of PSEG New Haven.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rated Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text: 9. Seller Category. Seller is a Category 2 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. ?? 35.36(a), in the Northeast region. Seller is a Category 1 seller, as defined in 18 C.F.R. ?? 35.36(a), in all other regions: Central, Northwest, Southeast, Southwest and Southwest Power Pool regions.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rate Tariff

record_data.record_plain_text:
7. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. a) PSEG Haven???s market-based rate authority is subject to the following limitation set forth in PSEG New Haven LLC, ER12-1250-000 (2012): (i) Notwithstanding the waiver of the accounting and reporting requirements, PSEG New Haven is expected to keep its accounting records in accordance with generally accepted accounting principles.
b) Exemptions granted in PSEG New Haven LLC, ER12-1250-000 (2012):
(i) Waiver of subparts B and C of Part 35 of the Commission's regulations requiring the filing of cost-of-service information, except for Sections 35.12(a), 35.13(b), 35.15, and 35.16.
(ii) Waiver of Parts 41, 101 and 141 of the Commission???s regulations regarding adjustment and certification of accounts and reports and the filing of certain statements and reports, except for Sections 141.14 and 141.15.
(iii) Blanket approval under Section 204 of the FPA and Part 34 of the Commission's regulations on future issuances of securities and assumptions of liabilities.
record_data.filing_title: PSEG New Haven LLC Market Based Rate Tariff
